comment: Mornin Gabsters, People are saying Gab is going to be shut down soon, maybe as soon as tomorrow. If it is, make sure you join MeWe, it's a different format based mainly on groups, but there is also a Timeline. You'll soon get used to it
amr:
# ::snt Mornin Gabsters, People are saying Gab is going to be shut down soon, maybe as soon as tomorrow. If it is, make sure you join MeWe, it's a different format based mainly on groups, but there is also a Timeline. You'll soon get used to it
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (s / say-01
            :ARG0 (p / person)
            :ARG1 (s2 / shut-down-05
                  :ARG1 (p2 / product
                        :name (n / name
                              :op1 "Gab"))
                  :time (s3 / soon)
                  :ARG1-of (m2 / mean-01
                        :ARG2 (p3 / possible-01
                              :ARG1 (a / as-soon-as
                                    :op1 (t / tomorrow))))))
      :snt2 (e / ensure-01
            :mode imperative
            :ARG0 (y / you)
            :ARG1 (j / join-04
                  :ARG0 y
                  :ARG1 (o / organization
                        :name (n2 / name
                              :op1 "MeWe")
                        :ARG1-of (d / differ-02)
                        :ARG1-of (b / base-02
                              :ARG2 (g / group)
                              :mod (m3 / main))
                        :ARG1-of (c / contrast-01
                              :ARG2 (t2 / timeline
                                    :mod (a2 / also)))))
            :condition s2)
      :snt3 (g2 / get-03
            :ARG1 (y2 / you)
            :ARG2 (u / use-02
                  :ARG0 y2
                  :ARG1 (ii / it))
            :time (s4 / soon)
            :snt4-of m)
      :ARG1 y2
      :ARG2 u
      :ARG0 y2
      :ARG1 ii)

comment: Why should Gab be shut down? No one has threatened to shut down Twitter or Facebook, and there are some real nut jobs over there, starting with Zuckerberg.
amr:

(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (c / cause-01
            :ARG0 (a / amr-unknown)
            :ARG1 (r / recommend-01
                  :ARG1 (s / shut-down-05
                        :ARG1 (o / organization
                              :name (n / name
                                    :op1 "Gab")))))
      :snt2 (a2 / and
            :op1 (t / threaten-01
                  :ARG0 (n2 / no-one)
                  :ARG1 (s2 / shut-down-05
                        :ARG0 n2
                        :ARG1 (o2 / or
                              :op1 (p / publication
                                    :name (n3 / name
                                          :op1 "Twitter"))
                              :op2 (p2 / publication
                                    :name (n4 / name
                                          :op1 "Facebook")))))
            :op2 (j / job
                  :mod (n5 / nutjob
                        :ARG1-of (r2 / real-04)
                        :quant (s3 / some)
                        :location (t2 / there)
                        :ARG1-of (s4 / start-01
                              :ARG2 (p3 / person
                                    :name (n6 / name
                                          :op1 "Zimmerman")))))))

comment: Yeah, I don't care for him either, but I'd watch the language a bit.  We understand your point.

comment: Using words that profanely refer to parts of a person of a specific gender are neither productive nor careful.

      :op1 (p / productive-03
            :polarity -
            :ARG0 (u / use-01
                  :ARG1 (w / word
                        :ARG0-of (r / refer-01
                              :ARG1 (p2 / part
                                    :part-of (p3 / person
                                          :mod (g / gender
                                                :ARG1-of (s / specific-02))))
                              :manner (p4 / profane)))))
      :op2 (c / care-04
            :polarity -
            :ARG0 u))
